t: O*pn Lord,*s You are*i my God. I*ld will exalt You, I*ld will praise Your name, For*ld You have done wonderful things;*i Your*ild counsels of old are*i faithfulness and*i truth.
For*ld You have made a city a ruin, A*ld fortified city a ruin, A*ld palace of foreigners to be a city no more; It*ld will never be rebuilt.
Therefore*ld the strong people will glorify You; The*ld city of the terrible nations will fear You.

For*ld You have been a strength to the poor, A*ld strength to the needy in his distress, A*ld refuge from the storm, A*ld shade from the heat; For*ld the blast of the terrible ones is*i as a storm against*i the wall.
You*ld will reduce the noise of aliens, As*ld heat in a dry place; As*ild heat in the shadow of a cloud, The*ld song of the terrible ones will be diminished.

And*ln in this mountain The*ld Lord*s of hosts will make for all people A*ld feast of choice pieces, A*ld feast of wines on the lees, Of*ld fat things full of marrow, Of*ld well-refined wines on the lees.
And*ld He will destroy on this mountain The*ld surface of the covering cast over all people, And*ld the veil that is spread over all nations.
He*ld will swallow up death forever, And*ld the Lord God*s will wipe away tears from all faces; The*ld rebuke of His people He*ld will take away from all the earth; For*ld the Lord*s has spoken.

And*ln it will be said in that day: “Behold,*ld this is*i our God; We*ld have waited for Him, and He will save us. This*ld is*i the Lord;*s We*ld have waited for Him; We*ld will be glad and rejoice in His salvation.”
For*ln on this mountain the hand of the Lord*s will rest, And*ld Moab shall be trampled down under Him, As*ld straw is trampled down for the refuse heap.
And*ld He will spread out His hands in their midst As*ld a swimmer reaches out to swim, And*ld He will bring down their pride Together*ld with the trickery of their hands.
The*ld fortress of the high fort of your walls He*ld will bring down, lay low, And*ild bring to the ground, down to the dust.
